questions.title: Is Palindrome
questions.description:
Check if the given string is a palindrome.

| Test Case | Input                             | Expected Output | Notes                                      |
|-----------|-----------------------------------|------------------|--------------------------------------------|
| 1         | "racecar"                         | true             | Normal case                                |
| 2         | "hello"                           | false            | Not a palindrome                           |
| 3         | "madam"                           | true             | Palindrome                                 |
| 4         | "A man a plan a canal Panama"     | true             | Ignore case/space                          |
| 5         | "ab"                              | false            | Not a palindrome                           |
| 6         | "abba"                            | true             | Palindrome                                 |
| 7         | "abcba"                           | true             | Palindrome                                 |
| 8         | "abccba"                          | true             | Palindrome                                 |
| 9         | ""                                | true             | Empty string                               |
| 10        | "No lemon, no melon"              | true             | Palindrome with punctuation                |
| 11        | "Step on no pets"                 | true             | Palindrome with punctuation                |
| 12        | "Was it a car or a cat I saw?"    | true             | Punctuation and case-insensitive           |
| 13        | "Eva, can I see bees in a cave?"  | true             | Long with punctuation                      |
| 14        | "Mr. Owl ate my metal worm"       | true             | Mixed case and spaces                      |
| 15        | "Able was I ere I saw Elba"       | true             | Mixed case and spaces                      |
| 16        | "Never odd or even"               | true             | Common palindrome phrase                   |
| 17        | "Madam In Eden I'm Adam"          | true             | Case and punctuation insensitive           |
| 18        | "Yo, Banana Boy!"                 | true             | Palindrome with symbols                    |
| 19        | "12321"                           | true             | Numeric palindrome                         |
| 20        | "123456"                          | false            | Non-palindrome numbers                     |
| 21        | "1a2"                              | false            | Near palindrome but not                    |
| 22        | "a."                               | true             | Single letter with punctuation             |
| 23        | "Red roses run no risk, sir, on Nurse's order" | true   | Complex sentence, ignore punctuation       |
| 24        | "abccbx"                           | false            | One character off                          |
| 25        | "   "                              | true             | Only spaces                                |
| 26        | "   a   "                          | true             | Spaces around a character                  |
| 27        | "A Toyota's a Toyota"             | true             | Palindrome with apostrophe                 |
| 28        | "Madam, in Eden, I'm Adam"        | true             | With commas                                |
| 29        | "Was it Eliot's toilet I saw?"    | true             | Apostrophe and question mark               |
| 30        | "Do geese see God?"               | true             | Phrase with punctuation                    |
| 31        | "Ã‰sope reste ici et se repose"    | true             | French phrase with accents                 |
| 32        | "ã‚ã„ã„ã‚"                         | true             | Japanese palindrome                        |
| 33        | "ðŸ™‚ðŸ™ƒðŸ™‚"                            | true             | Emoji palindrome                           |
| 34        | "ðŸ™‚ðŸ™ƒðŸ˜"                            | false            | Not a palindrome with emojis               |
| 35        | "abcbaabcba"                      | false            | Repeating pattern but not mirrored         |
| 36        | "Taco cat"                         | true             | Famous case-insensitive palindrome         |
| 37        | "Cigar? Toss it in a can. It is so tragic." | true  | Long sentence with punctuation            |
| 38        | "   R   A   C   E   C   A   R   "  | true             | Spaced out characters                      |
| 39        | "noon"                             | true             | Common simple palindrome                   |
| 40        | "notpalindrome"                   | false            | Control case                               |

questions.title: Check Anagram
questions.description:
Check whether two strings are anagrams of each other.

| Test Case | Input 1       | Input 2       | Expected Output | Notes                                |
|-----------|----------------|----------------|------------------|--------------------------------------|
| 1         | "listen"       | "silent"       | true             | Basic anagram                       |
| 2         | "hello"        | "bello"        | false            | Different letters                   |
| 3         | "triangle"     | "integral"     | true             | Same letters                        |
| 4         | "aabbcc"       | "abcabc"       | true             | Rearranged                          |
| 5         | "rat"          | "car"          | false            | Not anagram                         |
| 6         | ""             | ""             | true             | Both empty                          |
| 7         | "a"            | "a"            | true             | Single letter                       |
| 8         | "ab"           | "ba"           | true             | Two letters                         |
| 9         | "abc"          | "cba"          | true             | Simple reverse                      |
| 10        | "god"          | "dog"          | true             | Classic anagram                     |
| 11        | "evil"         | "vile"         | true             | Common anagram                     |
| 12        | "dusty"        | "study"        | true             | Rearranged                          |
| 13        | "school master"| "the classroom"| true             | With spaces                         |
| 14        | "Debit card"   | "Bad credit"   | true             | Case and space insensitive          |
| 15        | "Astronomer"   | "Moon starer"  | true             | Famous example                      |
| 16        | "The eyes"     | "They see"     | true             | Ignore case and spaces              |
| 17        | "conversation" | "voices rant on"| true            | Ignore space                        |
| 18        | "dormitory"    | "dirty room"   | true             | Space handling                      |
| 19        | "Eleven plus two"| "Twelve plus one"| true         | Long phrase                         |
| 20        | "aabbcc"       | "aabbc"        | false            | One char missing                    |
| 21        | "abcd"         | "abce"         | false            | One different letter                |
| 22        | "   "          | ""             | true             | Whitespace ignored                  |
| 23        | "Night"        | "Thing"        | true             | Case insensitive                    |
| 24        | "cinema"       | "iceman"       | true             | Classic anagram                     |
| 25        | "fluster"      | "restful"      | true             | Rearranged                          |
| 26        | "conversation" | "conservation" | true             | Rearranged                          |
| 27        | "aacc"         | "ccaa"         | true             | Character counts match              |
| 28        | "aacc"         | "acca"         | true             | Different order                     |
| 29        | "A"            | "a"            | true             | Case ignored                        |
| 30        | "abcd123"      | "321dcba"      | true             | Alphanumeric                        |
| 31        | "abc!"         | "c!ba"         | true             | Punctuation kept                    |
| 32        | "a!b@c"        | "c@b!a"        | true             | Punctuation reordered                |
| 33        | "12345"        | "54321"        | true             | Numbers only                        |
| 34        | "ðŸ™‚ðŸ™ƒ"          | "ðŸ™ƒðŸ™‚"          | true             | Emojis                              |
| 35        | "ðŸ™‚ðŸ™ƒðŸ™ƒ"         | "ðŸ™‚ðŸ™ƒðŸ™‚"         | false            | Emojis differ                       |
| 36        | "abc d"        | "cab d"        | true             | Spaces within                       |
| 37        | "long string"  | "string long"  | true             | Long word pair                      |
| 38        | "test"         | "sett"         | true             | Rearranged letters                  |
| 39        | "looped"       | "poodle"       | false            | Letters don't match                 |
| 40        | "stop"         | "pots"         | true             | Common example                      |

questions.title: Longest Common Prefix
questions.description:
Find the longest common prefix among an array of strings.

| Test Case | Input                              | Expected Output | Notes                              |
|-----------|-------------------------------------|------------------|------------------------------------|
| 1         | ["flower","flow","flight"]          | "fl"             | Common prefix exists              |
| 2         | ["dog","racecar","car"]             | ""               | No common prefix                  |
| 3         | ["interstellar", "internet"]        | "inter"          | Partial prefix                    |
| 4         | ["apple"]                            | "apple"          | Single string                     |
| 5         | []                                   | ""               | Empty list                        |
| 6         | ["abc","abcd","ab"]                 | "ab"             | Varying lengths                   |
| 7         | ["a","a","a"]                        | "a"              | All same single character         |
| 8         | ["a","b"]                            | ""               | No common                         |
| 9         | ["prefix","prefixes"]                | "prefix"         | One is full prefix of another     |
| 10        | ["test","testing","tester"]         | "test"           | Partial matches                   |
| 11        | ["car","carpool","carpet"]          | "car"            | Common root                       |
| 12        | ["same","same","same"]              | "same"           | All same word                     |
| 13        | ["abcde","abcfgh"]                   | "abc"            | Prefix diverges after 3 letters   |
| 14        | ["x"]                                | "x"              | Single letter                     |
| 15        | ["x","xy","xyz"]                    | "x"              | Incremental growth                |
| 16        | ["flower","flow","flock"]           | "flo"            | Similar words                     |
| 17        | ["abc",""]                            | ""               | One empty string                  |
| 18        | [""]                                 | ""               | One empty string in list          |
| 19        | ["abc","abc","abcd"]                | "abc"            | 2 exact matches                   |
| 20        | ["1234","123","12345"]               | "123"            | Numeric prefixes                  |
| 21        | ["ðŸ™‚abc","ðŸ™‚ab"]                      | "ðŸ™‚ab"           | Unicode handling                  |
| 22        | ["longest","longer","long"]         | "long"           | Subset prefix                     |
| 23        | ["a","ab","abc"]                    | "a"              | Increasing in size                |
| 24        | ["space bar","space age"]            | "space "         | Include space                     |
| 25        | ["  abc","  ab"]                      | "  ab"           | Leading spaces                    |
| 26        | ["A","a"]                            | ""               | Case-sensitive                    |
| 27        | ["lower","LOWER"]                    | ""               | Case-sensitive                    |
| 28        | ["pre","prefix","preface"]           | "pre"            | Common prefix                     |
| 29        | ["coexist","coed","coer"]           | "coe"            | Short common part                 |
| 30        | ["test1","test2"]                    | "test"           | Ends diverge                      |
| 31        | ["abc123","abc"]                     | "abc"            | Shorter prefix                    |
| 32        | ["true","truly","truck"]             | "tru"            | Partial match                     |
| 33        | ["â€œquote","â€œquoted"]                 | "â€œquote"         | Special characters                |
| 34        | ["","","a"]                           | ""               | Two empty                         |
| 35        | ["zzzz","zzzx"]                       | "zzz"            | Close match                       |
| 36        | ["ab","cd"]                           | ""               | No match                          |
| 37        | ["" for _ in range(5)]               | ""               | All empty                         |
| 38        | ["same", "samee"]                    | "same"           | Close match                       |
| 39        | ["end.","end!"]                       | "end"            | Symbols at end                    |
| 40        | ["123abc","123a","123"]              | "123"            | Prefix of numbers/letters         |

questions.title: Reverse Words in a String
questions.description:
Reverse the words in a given string. Remove extra spaces.

| Test Case | Input                            | Expected Output              | Notes                              |
|-----------|----------------------------------|-------------------------------|------------------------------------|
| 1         | "the sky is blue"               | "blue is sky the"             | Normal case                        |
| 2         | "  hello world  "               | "world hello"                 | Leading/trailing spaces            |
| 3         | "a good   example"             | "example good a"              | Multiple spaces                    |
| 4         | "Bob Loves Alice"              | "Alice Loves Bob"             | Proper nouns                       |
| 5         | "Alice does not even like bob"| "bob like even not does Alice"| Long input                         |
| 6         | ""                             | ""                            | Empty string                       |
| 7         | " "                            | ""                            | Only space                         |
| 8         | "    a    b  c   "              | "c b a"                        | Random spaces                      |
| 9         | "a"                            | "a"                            | One word                           |
| 10        | "to be or not to be"           | "be to not or be to"          | Repetition                         |
| 11        | "Let's go!"                    | "go! Let's"                   | Punctuation                        |
| 12        | "good morning"                | "morning good"                | Two words                          |
| 13        | "morning good"                | "good morning"                | Reversed case                      |
| 14        | "Word"                         | "Word"                        | Single word                        |
| 15        | "one,two,three"               | "one,two,three"               | No space between punctuation       |
| 16        | "hello ðŸ˜Š world"              | "world ðŸ˜Š hello"              | Emoji                              |
| 17        | "ðŸ˜Š"                           | "ðŸ˜Š"                          | Single emoji                       |
| 18        | "one  two   three"            | "three two one"               | Irregular spaces                   |
| 19        | "  space before"              | "before space"                | Leading spaces                     |
| 20        | "after space   "              | "space after"                 | Trailing spaces                    |
| 21        | "a b c d e f g"               | "g f e d c b a"               | Long sequence                      |
| 22        | "    "                         | ""                            | Only spaces                        |
| 23        | "newline\nseparated"          | "newline\nseparated"          | No actual space                    |
| 24        | "tab\tseparated"              | "tab\tseparated"              | No actual space                    |
| 25        | "  mix   of \n and \t  "      | "\t and \n of mix"            | String literals                    |
| 26        | "reverse! this! now!"          | "now! this! reverse!"         | Punctuation handling               |
| 27        | "123 abc"                     | "abc 123"                     | Alphanumeric                       |
| 28        | "abc 123"                     | "123 abc"                     | Reverse order                      |
| 29        | "OneWord"                     | "OneWord"                     | No space                           |
| 30        | "Word  "                      | "Word"                        | Extra space                        |
| 31        | " Word"                       | "Word"                        | Leading space                      |
| 32        | "a  b  c"                      | "c b a"                        | Triple split                       |
| 33        | "this is"                     | "is this"                     | Two word reverse                   |
| 34        | "double  space"               | "space double"                | Double space                       |
| 35        | "long     space     here"     | "here space long"             | Multiple spaces                    |
| 36        | "symbols #! are ignored"      | "ignored are #! symbols"      | Special characters remain          |
| 37        | "why? what?"                  | "what? why?"                  | Reversal                           |
| 38        | "UpperCase Words"             | "Words UpperCase"             | Case matters                       |
| 39        | "mixed CASE"                  | "CASE mixed"                  | Case preserved                     |
| 40        | "odd  even  words"            | "words even odd"              | Order switch                       |
questions.answer:
def reverse_words(s):
    return ' '.join(s.strip().split()[::-1])

questions.title: Check if String is Substring
questions.description:
Given two strings s1 and s2, determine if s2 is a substring of s1. Return 'True' if s2 is a substring of s1, otherwise return 'False'.

| Test Case | Input s1          | Input s2    | Expected Output | Notes                         |
|-----------|-------------------|-------------|-----------------|-------------------------------|
| 1         | "hello"          | "ll"       | True            | "ll" is in "hello"         |
| 2         | "world"          | "or"       | True            | "or" is in "world"         |
| 3         | "abcde"          | "xyz"      | False           | "xyz" not in "abcde"       |
| 4         | "aabbcc"         | "bc"       | True            | "bc" is in "aabbcc"        |
| 5         | "testcase"       | "case"     | True            | "case" is in "testcase"    |
| 6         | "python"         | "py"       | True            | "py" is in "python"        |
| 7         | "substring"      | "string"   | True            | "string" is in "substring" |
| 8         | "abcdef"         | "def"      | True            | "def" is in "abcdef"       |
| 9         | "xyzxyz"         | "abc"      | False           | "abc" not in "xyzxyz"      |
| 10        | "a"              | "a"        | True            | "a" is in "a"              |

questions.title: String Compression
questions.description:
Given an array of characters, compress it using the counts of repeated characters.

| Test Case | Input            | Expected Output  | Notes                         |
|-----------|------------------|------------------|-------------------------------|
| 1         | ['a', 'a', 'b', 'b', 'c', 'c', 'c'] | ['a', '2', 'b', '2', 'c', '3'] | Normal case                  |
| 2         | ['a', 'a', 'a']   | ['a', '3']       | Only one repeated character  |
| 3         | ['a', 'b', 'c']   | ['a', 'b', 'c']  | No compression needed        |
| 4         | ['a', 'a', 'a', 'b', 'b', 'a', 'a'] | ['a', '3', 'b', '2', 'a', '2'] | Mixed characters              |
| 5         | ['z']             | ['z']            | Single character             |
| 6         | ['a', 'b', 'b', 'b', 'c', 'c', 'c'] | ['a', 'b', '3', 'c', '3'] | Repeated characters          |
| 7         | ['x', 'x', 'x', 'x', 'x', 'x'] | ['x', '6'] | Single repeated character    |
| 8         | ['a', 'a', 'a', 'a', 'a'] | ['a', '5']       | Multiple identical chars    |
| 9         | []                | []               | Empty array                 |
| 10        | ['a', 'b', 'c', 'a', 'a'] | ['a', '1', 'b', '1', 'c', '1', 'a', '2'] | Alternating characters       |
questions.answer:
def compress(chars):
    write = 0
    read = 0
    while read < len(chars):
        char = chars[read]
        count = 1
        while read + 1 < len(chars) and chars[read + 1] == char:
            read += 1
            count += 1
        chars[write] = char
        write += 1
        if count > 1:
            for c in str(count):
                chars[write] = c
                write += 1
        read += 1
    return chars[:write]

questions.title: Valid Anagram
questions.description:
Determine if one string is an anagram of another.

| Test Case | Input A     | Input B     | Expected Output | Notes                        |
|-----------|-------------|-------------|------------------|------------------------------|
| 1         | "anagram"   | "nagaram"  | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 2         | "rat"       | "car"      | false            | Not an anagram               |
| 3         | "hello"     | "ollhe"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 4         | "abc"       | "cba"      | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 5         | "a"         | "b"        | false            | Single characters not matching |
| 6         | "abcabc"    | "cbaabc"   | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 7         | "xyz"       | "zyx"      | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 8         | "abcd"      | "abdc"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 9         | "abcdefg"   | "gfedcba"  | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 10        | "pqrst"     | "qrstp"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 11        | "abcde"     | "edcba"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 12        | "abc"       | "acb"      | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 13        | "apple"     | "pale"     | false            | Different letter counts      |
| 14        | "night"     | "thing"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 15        | "kitten"    | "tinket"   | false            | Different letter counts      |
| 16        | "abcdef"    | "abcfde"   | false            | Different number of letters  |
| 17        | "moon"      | "mono"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 18        | "hello"     | "heoll"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 19        | "madam"     | "adamm"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 20        | "laptop"    | "tpalto"   | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 21        | "race"      | "care"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 22        | "silent"    | "listen"   | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 23        | "hello"     | "ellho"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 24        | "book"      | "obok"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 25        | "faded"     | "defad"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 26        | "rot"       | "tor"      | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 27        | "cold"      | "clod"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 28        | "miss"      | "sims"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 29        | "jumps"     | "spjum"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 30        | "snow"      | "owns"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 31        | "team"      | "mate"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 32        | "code"      | "ocde"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 33        | "listen"    | "silent"   | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 34        | "finder"    | "friend"   | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 35        | "alter"     | "later"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 36        | "test"      | "tset"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 37        | "action"    | "canto"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 38        | "sort"      | "rots"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 39        | "greet"     | "teerg"    | true             | Both are anagrams            |
| 40        | "knee"      | "keen"     | true             | Both are anagrams            |
questions.answer:
def is_anagram(a, b):
    return sorted(a) == sorted(b)

questions.title: Palindrome Permutation
questions.description:
Given a string, determine if a permutation of the string could form a palindrome.

| Test Case | Input        | Expected Output | Notes                         |
|-----------|--------------|------------------|-------------------------------|
| 1         | "civic"     | true             | "civic" itself is a palindrome |
| 2         | "ivicc"     | true             | Can be rearranged as "civic" |
| 3         | "hello"     | false            | Cannot be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 4         | "racecar"   | true             | Already a palindrome          |
| 5         | "abcde"     | false            | Cannot be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 6         | "aabbcc"    | true             | Can be rearranged as "abcabc" |
| 7         | "abcabcba"  | true             | Palindrome as is              |
| 8         | "aabbbb"    | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 9         | "aa"        | true             | Already a palindrome          |
| 10        | "abcd"      | false            | Cannot form a palindrome      |
| 11        | "a"         | true             | Single character palindrome   |
| 12        | "bbccbb"    | true             | Palindrome as is              |
| 13        | "bbccc"     | false            | Cannot form a palindrome      |
| 14        | "xxyyzz"    | true             | Can be rearranged as "xyzzyx" |
| 15        | "xyzzyx"    | true             | Palindrome as is              |
| 16        | "abbcbba"   | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 17        | "xyx"       | true             | Already a palindrome          |
| 18        | "abbac"     | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 19        | "abcabc"    | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 20        | "aabbccdd"  | true             | Can be rearranged as "abcdabcd" |
| 21        | "abbacc"    | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 22        | "abcdeff"   | false            | Cannot be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 23        | "abcdefg"   | false            | Cannot form a palindrome      |
| 24        | "bbbbcc"    | true             | Can be rearranged as "bbcb"  |
| 25        | "jjjjjj"    | true             | Already a palindrome          |
| 26        | "jjjjjjj"   | true             | Palindrome as is              |
| 27        | "kxyzk"     | true             | Already a palindrome          |
| 28        | "aaaaaaaaaaaa" | true          | Long even length palindrome   |
| 29        | "abcabcabc" | false            | Cannot form a palindrome      |
| 30        | "baabcc"    | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 31        | "abcdabcd"  | true             | Already a palindrome          |
| 32        | "oovvxx"    | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 33        | "zzzxxz"     | true            | Can be rearranged as a palindrome |
| 34        | "abbccccba"  | true            | Already a palindrome         |
| 35        | "abcabcab"   | false           | Cannot form a palindrome       |
| 36        | "cbbabbbc"  | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 37        | "aaccbbdd"   | true            | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
| 38        | "abccbaab"   | true            | Palindrome as is              |
| 39        | "dacefd"     | false            | Cannot form a palindrome      |
| 40        | "bbccaa"     | true             | Can be rearranged to form a palindrome |
questions.answer:
from collections import Counter

def can_permute_palindrome(s):
    count = Counter(s)
    odd_count = sum(1 for c in count.values() if c % 2 == 1)
    return odd_count <= 1

questions.title: Count and Say
Count Character Occurrences
questions.description:
Given a string s and a character c, count the number of occurrences of c in s. Return the count as an integer.

| Test Case | Input s           | Input c | Expected Output | Notes                          |
|-----------|-------------------|---------|-----------------|-------------------------------|
| 1         | "hello"          | "l"     | 2               | "l" appears twice           |
| 2         | "world"          | "o"     | 1               | "o" appears once            |
| 3         | "abcabc"         | "a"     | 2               | "a" appears twice           |
| 4         | "testcase"       | "t"     | 2               | "t" appears twice           |
| 5         | "python"         | "p"     | 1               | "p" appears once            |
| 6         | "aaaaaa"         | "a"     | 6               | "a" appears six times       |
| 7         | "xyzxyz"         | "w"     | 0               | "w" does not appear         |
| 8         | "mississippi"    | "s"     | 4               | "s" appears four times      |
| 9         | "banana"         | "n"     | 2               | "n" appears twice           |
| 10        | "empty"          | "e"     | 1               | "e" appears once            |

questions.title: Reverse String
questions.description:
Given a string s, return the string obtained by reversing s.

| Test Case | Input s           | Expected Output | Notes                          |
|-----------|-------------------|-----------------|-------------------------------|
| 1         | "hello"          | "olleh"        | Reversed string              |
| 2         | "world"          | "dlrow"        | Reversed string              |
| 3         | "abc"            | "cba"          | Reversed string              |
| 4         | "a"              | "a"            | Single character             |
| 5         | "python"         | "nohtyp"       | Reversed string              |
| 6         | "test"           | "tset"         | Reversed string              |
| 7         | "xyzxyz"         | "zyxzyx"       | Reversed string              |
| 8         | "aaa"            | "aaa"          | Reversed palindrome          |
| 9         | "12345"          | "54321"        | Reversed string              |
| 10        | "empty"          | "ytpme"        | Reversed string              |
questions.answer:
def reverse_string(s):
    return s[::-1]

s = input().strip()
print(reverse_string(s))

questions.title: Check if String is Palindrome
questions.description:
Given a string s, determine if it is a palindrome (reads the same forward and backward). Return 'True' if it is a palindrome, otherwise return 'False'. Ignore case and non-alphanumeric characters.

| Test Case | Input s           | Expected Output | Notes                          |
|-----------|-------------------|-----------------|-------------------------------|
| 1         | "racecar"        | True            | Is a palindrome              |
| 2         | "hello"          | False           | Not a palindrome             |
| 3         | "A man a plan a canal Panama" | True | Palindrome after cleaning |
| 4         | "abc"            | False           | Not a palindrome             |
| 5         | "aaa"            | True            | Is a palindrome              |
| 6         | "12321"          | True            | Is a palindrome              |
| 7         | "xyz"            | False           | Not a palindrome             |
| 8         | "Madam"          | True            | Case-insensitive palindrome  |
| 9         | "a"              | True            | Single character palindrome  |
| 10        | "abca"           | False           | Not a palindrome             |

questions.title: Word Pattern
questions.description:
Given a pattern and a string str, find if str follows the same pattern.

| Test Case | Input Pattern | Input String | Expected Output | Notes                       |
|-----------|---------------|--------------|-----------------|-----------------------------|
| 1         | "abba"        | "dog cat cat dog" | true           | Follows the same pattern  |
| 2         | "abba"        | "dog cat cat fish" | false          | Does not follow the pattern |
| 3         | "abc"         | "dog dog dog"     | false          | Each letter must map to a unique word |
| 4         | "a"           | "dog"            | true           | Single character pattern   |
| 5         | "abab"        | "dog cat cat dog" | true           | Maps correctly             |
| 6         | "abcde"       | "dog cat fish dog" | false          | Not enough words for pattern |
| 7         | "xyz"         | "a b a"          | false          | Does not follow pattern    |
| 8         | "ab"          | "a a a"          | false          | Letters must map uniquely  |
| 9         | "aaa"         | "dog dog dog"    | true           | Maps correctly             |
| 10        | "abcd"        | "one two three four" | true          | Each pattern corresponds to a unique word |
| 11        | "aabb"        | "dog cat cat dog" | true           | Follows the pattern         |
| 12        | "abc"         | "apple banana cherry" | true         | Each letter maps to a unique word |
| 13        | "aabbcc"       | "cat dog dog cat"  | false          | Does not match the pattern   |
| 14        | "aaaa"        | "hello hello hello hello" | true        | Same word repetition        |
| 15        | "abab"        | "apple banana apple banana" | true        | Alternating pattern         |
| 16        | "abcd"        | "dog dog cat dog" | false          | Does not match pattern      |
| 17        | "abb"          | "one two two one" | true           | Repeats letters for words  |
| 18        | "abcabc"      | "dog cat fish dog cat fish" | true         | Repeating pattern of 3    |
| 19        | "xyxy"        | "cat cat dog dog" | true           | Same alternating pattern   |
| 20        | "abc"         | "apple banana carrot" | true         | Each word is distinct        |
| 21        | "abcd"        | "dog cat fish hen" | true          | Each pattern matches words |
| 22        | "abac"        | "a b a c"        | true           | Matches single letter to words  |
| 23        | "abc"         | "x y z"          | true           | Uniquely mapped letters    |
| 24        | "a"           | "x"              | true           | Single character pattern    |
| 25        | "ababab"      | "x y x y x y"    | true           | Repeated alternating pattern |
| 26        | "abab"        | "apple banana apple banana" | true        | Same alternating pattern   |
| 27        | "abcabcabc"   | "apple banana cherry apple banana cherry apple" | true | Repeated pattern           |
| 28        | "abca"        | "a b a c"        | true           | Correct alternating pattern |
| 29        | "aaaa"        | "cat cat cat cat" | true           | Same word repeated         |
| 30        | "aab"          | "dog dog dog"    | false          | Does not match pattern    |
| 31        | "abcd"        | "apple apple orange orange" | false        | Does not match the pattern |
| 32        | "aabbcc"       | "cat dog dog cat"  | false          | Does not match pattern     |
| 33        | "abc"         | "dog cat fish"    | true           | All words follow the pattern |
| 34        | "a"           | "dog dog dog"    | false          | Pattern repeats more than expected |
| 35        | "aaaaa"        | "hello hello hello hello hello" | true       | Same word repeated         |
| 36        | "abcde"       | "dog dog dog dog dog" | false         | Does not match the pattern  |
| 37        | "abb"          | "cat dog dog cat" | true           | Matches pattern correctly  |
| 38        | "aab"          | "one two one"    | false          | Does not follow the pattern |
| 39        | "ab"          | "hello hello"     | false          | Pattern does not repeat correctly |
| 40        | "abac"         | "x y x y x y"     | false          | Does not match pattern    |

questions.title: Palindrome Permutation
questions.description:
Given a string, determine if it can be rearranged to form a palindrome. A palindrome is a word that reads the same forward and backward.

| Test Case | Input      | Expected Output | Notes                        |

| 10        | "aaa"     | true            | Palindrome                   |

questions.title: Group Anagrams
questions.description:
Given an array of strings, group the anagrams together.

| Test Case | Input Array                          | Expected Output                       | Notes                       |
|-----------|--------------------------------------|-------------------------------------|-----------------------------|
| 1         | ["eat", "tea", "tan", "ate", "nat", "bat"] | [["eat", "tea", "ate"], ["tan", "nat"], ["bat"]] | Anagrams grouped together |
| 2         | ["abc", "bca", "cab", "xyz"]   | [["abc", "bca", "cab"], ["xyz"]] | Anagrams grouped            |
| 3         | ["hello", "oellh", "world"]      | [["hello", "oellh"], ["world"]]  | Anagrams grouped            |
| 4         | ["a", "b", "c", "d"]           | [["a"], ["b"], ["c"], ["d"]]    | No anagrams                  |
| 5         | ["eat", "tea", "tan"]            | [["eat", "tea"], ["tan"]]        | Grouped anagrams            |
| 6         | ["madam", "dama", "dam", "mad"] | [["madam", "dama", "mad"], ["dam"]] | Grouped anagrams           |
| 7         | ["one", "none", "neo"]           | [["one", "neo"], ["none"]]        | Grouped anagrams            |
| 8         | ["abc", "xyz", "cab", "yzx"]    | [["abc", "cab"], ["xyz", "yzx"]] | Grouped anagrams            |
| 9         | ["food", "odf", "doff"]          | [["food", "odf"], ["doff"]]       | Grouped anagrams            |
| 10        | ["fool", "loof", "foo"]          | [["fool", "loof"], ["foo"]]       | Grouped anagrams            |
| 11        | ["cat", "act", "tac"]            | [["cat", "act", "tac"]]           | Grouped anagrams            |
| 12        | ["bat", "tab", "tap"]            | [["bat", "tab"], ["tap"]]         | Grouped anagrams            |
| 13        | ["dormitory", "dirty room", "room dirty"] | [["dormitory"], ["dirty room", "room dirty"]] | Grouped anagrams           |
| 14        | ["god", "dog", "odg"]            | [["god", "dog", "odg"]]           | Anagrams grouped together   |
| 15        | ["abcd", "bcda", "cdab"]         | [["abcd", "bcda", "cdab"]]        | Anagrams grouped            |
| 16        | ["tea", "eat", "ate"]            | [["tea", "eat", "ate"]]           | Grouped anagrams            |
| 17        | ["cat", "rat", "car"]            | [["cat", "rat", "car"]]           | Grouped anagrams            |
| 18        | ["god", "dog", "god", "odg"]    | [["god", "dog", "odg", "god"]]   | Grouped anagrams            |
| 19        | ["abc", "cab", "bac"]            | [["abc", "cab", "bac"]]           | Grouped anagrams            |
| 20        | ["hello", "hi", "oh"]            | [["hello"], ["hi"], ["oh"]]       | No anagrams                  |
| 21        | ["vampire", "ampirev", "vapirem"] | [["vampire", "ampirev"], ["vapirem"]] | Grouped anagrams          |
| 22        | ["god", "dog", "god", "ogd"]    | [["god", "dog", "ogd", "god"]]   | Grouped anagrams            |
| 23        | ["python", "typhon", "onpyth"]    | [["python", "typhon", "onpyth"]]  | Grouped anagrams            |
| 24        | ["madam", "damam", "madma"]       | [["madam", "damam", "madma"]]      | Grouped anagrams            |
| 25        | ["hello", "helol", "ohell"]       | [["hello", "helol", "ohell"]]      | Grouped anagrams            |
